DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Infiltrating Lymphocyte Harvest Access Procedure Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of surgical procedure used to secure Tumor Infiltrating Lymphocyte or TIL harvest access.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Infiltrating Lymphocyte Harvest Access Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Lymphocytes that show specificity for autologous tumor cells and can infiltrate a tumor._Remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation._The right to obtain or make use of or take advantage of something (as services or membership); the right to enter.  Also, an act or means of approaching._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Lymphocytes that show specificity for autologous tumor cells. Ex vivo isolation and culturing of TIL with interleukin-2, followed by reinfusion into the patient, is one form of adoptive immunotherapy of cancer.:Remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation.

Concepts.definition: Lymphocytes that show specificity for autologous tumor cells and can infiltrate a tumor.
Remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation.
